title: Why are there no women in Pro Leagues?
body: Just wondered why you never see the ladies in any pro matches. Anyone wanna give their thoughts?

replies.body: There was one in the NA LCS last season or the season before i cant remember. She played for the Renegades.

apparently **t**ranny is a filtered word.
That's because the word you mentioned is often seen as a derogatory way of addressing transgendered or transsexual individuals, depending on context.

excuse me but this is Australia, when someone says that word it isn't derogatory because it's just common slang, generally most Australians are "conservative" so I can see why people would be scared, but really who is getting offended by someone saying %%%%%%, it's the same as saying gay compared to homosexual realistically.

I'm not going to get too political about this, but the comparison you made is false. The word in question is a direct derivative and slur of the appropriate word(s), while the two words you mentioned are synonymous, and also completely appropriate ways of referring to those who are attracted to the same sex.

Computers don't read things via human interfaces, that's reserved for humans. As far as computers are concerned, he was looking at a string of characters that look like this "['][']t['][']ranny" (switch "[']" with "*") which it meant nothing to the computer because to him it looks nothing like the other filtered word he should be watching out for.

If you instead try to filter out every single possible spelling variation, shortening, and otherwise creative representation and association of a word, the list is simply impossible to be made and managed not to mention many otherwise non-hostile words will also be blocked too. So that's really a no-go.

But then again, most of the responsibility of not using obviously derogatory terms lie in ourselves and not the law enforcers to begin with. Rules are supposed to keep people in line, but not out to drag people under it. You don't want to be in a place where they put keeping laws in order before their people.

Multiple reasons.

Sexism could be one, but Riot does well to minimise this within the League community.
There are plenty of League Streamers, and a fair few of them are high elo, however they seem completely satisfied with their current position rather than pushing themselves further.

That leads into competitive drive.
It's unfortunate but females naturally have lower competitive drive than males, there are many many reasons for this, but you'll note that a female with high testosterone levels (could be from any reason, genetic or otherwise) are typically more aggressive and competitive.

There are a lot more reasons I could go into, but I'm not in the mood to debate at the moment.
https://youtu.be/Kj4xpEepRTM You bronze scrub do u even  research on LEAUGE of legends

the answer is simple

Women can definitely join teams in the pro leagues , there just haven't been any thus far to devote intense amount of hours of the day to attain the levels of skill deemed worthy ie challenger.
It mostly comes down to them that for whatever reason, which I won't attempt to delve into, are for the very most part not interested in going into pro competitive level of play in League.
Because if there was a full team of girls no one would play Top or Jungle, and the game for them would only revolve around the female champions.
Because a team of 5 support mains would be useless in pro play :^)

Lets just be thankful that its this way, instead of pro teams having a quota of women to fill, and thus turning away more qualified gamers just to be "politically correct".

And even though he was joking around, CHEESYLEEKS's comment probably has a small spark of truth somewhere in it (but not quite for the reasons he stated...).
You'll notice that none of the male pros are butt-ugly either?

When a company is looking for a gamer to sponsor, the gamer becomes the flagship of the company's advertising.  And no company wants some obese pimply nerd with 5x magnified glasses (stereotypical gamer), wearing their logo, cos lets be frank... that doesn't sell.
So its fair enough that they'll pick someone with slightly less skill, but much better looks _(because after all, they do have to sell their products)_.

And because we are exposed to so much feminine beauty on TV and in advertising, we are very accustomed to seeing unnaturally stunning women for everything, and so when you find an actual normal non-supermodel girl, even if she is still good looking, she doesn't work for advertising because she just cant compare to the selectively-picked 1 in a million supermodels that we are accustomed to.

And the likelihood of finding a stunningly hot girl at that level of gaming is probably incredibly low. Because chances are, If you're that hot, you'll know it, opportunities will come much easier to you, and before you even reach that level of gaming, you'll realise that there will be far better and far easier paths through life than sitting for 12 hours a day practicing playing champions that aren't even as hot as you, getting that sweet screen tan, just for the chance of going pro someday.

However because of how men are portrayed in advertising and on TV (its more about the presence, rather than the visuals), the population is less selective about their looks. So as long as he isn't too bad, you can pull off putting an average/above-average guy in an advertising role.

_______

Im sure its not the only reason, but its bound to be a contributing factor. 

And I'm not saying its fair! 

TBH if you're the best gamer (or best anything) you should be able to be selected no matter how you look. Its a sad thing, but the world just doesn't work like that. Its in our instincts to like the best looking things.
It must be because they get baited and outsmarted too often.
